Ohitsuzen Tanbo Review | Bon Appetit









































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLogintokyoOhitsuzen TanboWith rice this good, you almost forget about the fresh fish that tops it (almost).FacebookPinterestTwitterEmailPhoto by Xavier Girard Lachaîne“I seek out Ohitsuzen Tanbo during each visit. It’s a casual spot that focuses on high-quality, perfectly steamed rice. The little jewels are served in a beautiful wooden box and topped with salmon roe, crispy salmon skin, grilled eel, and other fish. There are only about 20 seats; a line forms during lunch hour because it’s so popular with locals.”—Melissa King of Co+Lab in San FranciscoExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
